TEXT: The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On an unspecified date in DATE , the authorities conducted a land registry survey in ORG , during which the land allegedly belonging to the applicants ' ancestors was registered in the land registry in the name of other individuals and the ORG .

Following this , PERSON , the father and uncle to several of the applicants , brought actions to intervene in the proceedings before ORG , claiming that the land in fact belonged to his mother . The information in the relevant files can be summarised as follows .
On DATE , PERSON brought an action against ORG and the ORG , contesting the result of the cadastral survey and claiming that the plot of land no . CARDINAL belonged to him .
On DATE ORG dismissed the claims of PERSON and ordered that the contested land be registered in the name of ORG

PERSON did not appeal against this judgment . However , the ORG appealed . ORG quashed the judgment and remitted the case to ORG . The latter delivered its second judgment on DATE , confirming the first .
The applicants were not party to these proceedings .
On DATE the ORG rendered a judgment , which became final DATE . PERSON was not a party to these proceedings .
On DATE , PERSON brought another action before ORG , contesting the cadastral record of a plot of land , no . CARDINAL , along with other plaintiffs .
He failed to attend the hearings held after DATE , or to submit his witness list , despite the court 's request .
None of the applicants pursued the case as the heirs of PERSON .
On DATE the court delivered its judgment and dismissed PERSON claims . On DATE , PERSON grandson , PERSON ( not an applicant in the present case ) , was notified of this judgment .
